p.s: In the following it will be analysed how Barack Obama tries to convince his audience that dreams are worth fighting for (l. 25f.).

Obama started with the enumeration and antithesis About how we're becoming more separated by geography and ideology; race and religion; wealth and opportunity (l. 4-6) through which he described how many differences America has and how good they are.

The effect of the use of those rhetorical devicedevices is that the audience gets told how close those differences are to each other and that it is a big content wisecontentwise contras, but with looking closer they are and work very close together.

Furthermore the future president used the klimaxclimax Americans share a faith in simple dreams... Common hopes.American dreams (ll. 10-12) to clarify his supporters to believe in something and hopefully the American dreamDream.
Through this he builded a connection to everybody, because not everyone has the faith in the American dreamDream, but should have faith in something, even though it is just something very small.

Moreover Barack Obama uses a personal histerical argument in the forthfourth paragraph where he tells his audience on how his family lived the American dreamDream at first very small and at the end big enough to rais the future president.
Thus his family achieved through hard work and the believebelief in the American dreamDream.

Additionally the anaphora and klimaxclimax no barriers to success - no matter what color you are, no matter where you're from, no matter how much money you have (ll. 19-20) clarifysclarifies for the audience that they can believe in themselfsthemselves and have no excuse for not believing or working hard for their dreams.
The effect is that everybody feels picked up, because every of those arguments fir to everyone.
All people are different and believe in different dreams and hopes, but when they work hard they can lifelive their personal American dreamDream.
All in all Barack Obama convinced his audience through the use of rhetorical devices of the faith in the American dreamDream, because he and his family build a life through hard work from scratch.
With the example of his own family the audience feels included and it is easier for them to try to believe in the American dreamDream as well.
